item.title: Decoding the Frustrations and Vulnerabilities of Modern Text Processing
item.description:
Description

When it comes to processing text, Python is easily one of the best languages for the job. However, in today's modern world, with emojisğŸ‘ŒğŸ», Æ’Î¿ÑÎµÎ¹gÎ· â„“Î±nÎ³uÎ±gÎµs, and mÌ•aÌ¨Ì•Ì¶lÍicÌ·iÍÍœoÌ¶ÍŸÍœusÍ  Ò‰ÍdÌ´aÍœtÌ›Í˜ÌµaÌ¨Ò‰ we are no longer dealing with easy and safe to handle ASCII input.

Join us as we go through the adventures of battling UnicodeError dragons, working with Python3's I/O, what to do when working with bytes, how to account for data from the web and/or databases nicely, what the different types of string literals are, the new f"{format_strings}", and the security vulnerabilities that string formatting and malicious input can possess (and how to prevent it).
item.dc:creator: Evan Kohilas
